metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10188 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
utility.c in telnetd in netkit telnet through 0.17 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via short writes or urgent data, because of a buffer overflow involving the netclear and nextitem functions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

telnet - 0.17-36build2
telnetd - 0.17-36build2
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> in netkit-telnet, this CVE was patched in 0.17-18woody2. See https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=953477 for more information.

criterions.comment: inetutils package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
netkit-telnet package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17-36build2').
netkit-telnet-ssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
